description.narrative: This project will address the digital information and campaigning gaps that will push women’s rights and political participation inthe public agendas of Somalia/Somaliland. This will be achieved through development of powerful and change-inspiring campaigns to be promulgated through various digital platforms – Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and TV channels. Extensive discussions are occurring online in Somalia/Somaliland, which have significance on the national debate, with middle class and urban youth being particularly active online. Their subsequent influence on community-level discussions is significant and thus need to be shaped by appropriate information. Featuring video and other engaging content, will help counter negative online discussions and contribute towards greater public acceptance of women’s rights in Somaliland. This project will engage a range of actors working on women’s rights and digital influencing. NAGAAD Network and SSWC, two leading women’s rights organizations and an established partners of Oxfam, will lead in coordinating campaigns by engaging relevant actors that will add weight to the campaigns. NAGAAD and SSWC will organize workshops and debate sessions where burning issues around women’s political participation and how best to influence increased representation of women in elected bodies. This project will empower women and female youth activists to use social media to shape public perceptions of gender ideas, beliefs, and values and serve as an important means of generating women’s awareness about their subordinate or even oppressed status. A group of prominent social media campaigners will be established to create campaigns and hashtags and frequently post, retweet news, commentaries, and articles to enhance the visibility of various women’s issues at global and national levels. These campaigns will shed light on specific issues including fighting domestic violence, women’s rights, sexual harassment in the workplace, gender equality, women’s development, and stereotypedgender representations in the media.

participating-org.narrative: Nagaad is the women#s network in Somaliland, which ON has been supporting since its establishment in1997. Nagaad was formed by 32 women#s groups in Hargeisa. While it has raised its profile tremendously after 2000, with a range of advocacy and publicity actions in the media, notably around women#s political participation, it has always remained a of 32 member organisations, many of them remain weak, except for a few larger ones (some of whom are also counterparts of Oxfam Novib). Nagaad built its own office and received support from a variety of donors. Over the last four years Nagaad has elaborated a restructuring plan and a new strategic plan that involves: (a) more focus on networking instead of direct implementation; (b) admission of 15 new members from the regions of Somaliland, and working relationships with regional women#s umbrellas and professional associations. The network now has a membership of 46organisations.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

description.narrative: Strengthened CSOs: # CSOs increasingly participate in or initiate influencing and advocacy efforts on issues related to transformative leadership and women's political participation.
